text: Nicholas Paul (born 23 September 1998) is a Trinidadian track cyclist, who specializes in sprinting events. ==Major results== ;2015 : 1st Kilometer, Junior National Track Championships ;2017 : 1st Sprint, National Track Championships : 2nd 20px Team sprint, Pan American Track Championships (with Kwesi Browne & Njisane Phillip) ;2018 : Central American and Caribbean Games ::1st 20px Kilometer ::1st 20px Sprint ::1st 20px Team sprint (with Kwesi Browne & Njisane Phillip) : Pan American Track Championships ::1st 20px Team sprint (with Kwesi Browne & Njisane Phillip) ::2nd 20px Sprint ::3rd 20px Kilometer :On Friday September 6, 2019, Paul set a flying 200m world record of 9.100 seconds at the Elite Pan American Track Cycling Championships in Coachabamba, Bolivia. The previous record of 9.347 seconds by France's Francois Pervis had stood since 2013. ==References== Category:1994 births Category:Living people Category:Trinidad and Tobago male cyclists Category:Trinidad and Tobago track cyclists Category:Place of birth missing (living people) Category:Central American and Caribbean Games gold medalists for Trinidad and Tobago Category:Competitors at the 2018 Central American and Caribbean Games Category:Pan American Games medalists in cycling Category:Pan American Games gold medalists for Trinidad and Tobago Category:Cyclists at the 2019 Pan American Games Category:Central American and Caribbean Games medalists in cycling
title: Nicholas Paul (cyclist)
